column1: Let me look, Billie, and Donald reached out his hand for the field glass through which Broncho Billie was gazing down from the summit of Real del Monte upon the plain of Quesco
column2: through which the Pachuca river winds its way. "Maybe I can make out who they are."Billie handed over the glass without a word and stood expectant
column3: while Donald scrutinized closely a body of horsemen—twenty or more in number—which had halted beside the railroad that connects the little city of Pachuca with the City of Mexico."They are not soldiers
column5: was Donald's comment after he had inspected the riders carefully for a couple of minutes.That's what I thought
column6: from Billie. They look like a bunch of vaqueros to me; but what would a crowd of fifty cowpunchers be doing in a country where the only cattle are goats?"
